articles.contents:
If you have any queries please contact one of the organisers or send us an email at synbio.6@ubc.ca
Venue
AMS Student Nest, 6133 University Blvd, UBC, Vancouver, BC V6T 1Z1

articles.title: SynBio6.0
articles.description:
**6th Annual Synthetic Biology Symposium**  
May 16-17, 2024, Vancouver, BC, Canada
articles.contents:
SynBio6.0 (May 16-17, 2024) aims to bring the research community together to celebrate Canadian progress in this exciting and fast-growing field. The goal of this event it to promote collaborations and the exchange of ideas between synthetic biology research groups in Canada.
Keynote Speakers



Leopold Parts

Group Lead

Wellcome Sanger Institute



Pulin Li

Professor

Whitehead Institute, MIT



Rebecca Shapiro

Associate Professor

University of Guelph



Ron Weiss

Professor

MIT


This event provides a forum for our trainees to develop their skills in the science and business of synthetic biology. Trainees are invited to attend tutorial workshops, participate in discussion of synthetic biology training programs, to present their work through oral and poster presentations, and to network with other synbio researchers.



Register and Present →



Important Dates


Date

February 12th 2024
Registration Ends
May 9th 2024
Abstract Submission Deadline
April 17th 2024
Conference
May 16th - May 17th 2024

Venue
AMS Student Nest, 6133 University Blvd, UBC, Vancouver, BC V6T 1Z1

articles.title: Registration
articles.contents:
Register now at

this link





Important Dates


Date
Registration Opens
February 12th 2024
Registration Ends
May 9th 2024
Abstract Submission Deadline
April 17th 2024
Conference
May 16th - May 17th 2024

Abstract Submission:

Abstracts can be submitted  here 

All attendees are encouraged to submit abstracts. You can see the submission deadlines along with other important dates above. Abstracts are limited to ~2900 characters. Attendees will be notified regarding their abstract status a week after the submission deadline. Selected presenters will also be notified if they have been chosen to give a 15 minutes oral presentation in addition to poster presentation. Abstract submission deadline is April 17th 2024. Please make sure to register before submitting the abstract
Accomodation:
Exclusive accommodation options are available on the UBC Campus for conference attendees. These selected accommodations ensure a comfortable and convenient stay. For booking and payment, attendees can access the reservation through this link.
